comment_3: Lyrically and musically, this is one of Mariah's best-written songs.  It is probably inspired by her divorce, which left her both sad because she really loved her husband, and relieved that she was finally doing the right thing by breaking away from a time in her life that she described as "the height of her unhappiness".

I guess sometimes if you can't do anything to make the one you love happy, then all you can do is let them go, "if you should return to me, we truely were meant to be", is a hope to wait on, because that's all you can do is wait if your love is looking everywhere except at you.

comment_13: This is a very sad, yet such a beautiful song. There is a sense of freedom in it.. even though she is torn, she also seems uplifted and strong. It takes so much inner strength and courage to make a decision to let somebody go, to set them free. I think it's one of the hardest things to do in life. This song is just so beautiful, I think it's a bit underrated actually. Should have been a number 1 hit. I know the 'chart' doesn't really matter at the end of the day, but yeah. I love the whole build up in this song. The first half of the song she sings with a soft, gentle voice. Then the last half of the song she fully belts out the words/melody. Her voice is so powerful, it sends shivers down my spine and brings tears to my eyes. Mariah is a very vulnerable woman, she's so beautiful in every way. I love her songs so much.. especially powerful and impacting ballads like this one.
comment_14:
To me, this is the best song Mariah Carey's ever written. It is also my favorite song ever. It's just so beautifully written but what I think stands out the most is the melody and that incredible build. The song starts are very mellow but ends with such an impactful finish. I agree with daydreamer1 when they wrote that this song is underrated. This should have been such a bigger hit than what it was.

The song is very simple yet powerful: when you love someone, you should give them enough space to find themselves when needed; it may hurt, but you have to do it.
comment_15: Generally, the song is about letting a loved one go to see if they return. That has many interpretations depending on who is listening. In my opinion, the song isn't really about a break up. It's about letting the person you love go because you want what's best for them. Maybe it's because they have a career or a dream they've always wanted to pursue and you care so much you want them to reach it. In other words, you let them fly... and hope that one day, somehow they will find their way back into your life.
comment_16: Mariah has said that she wrote this song about her relationship with Tommy Mottola.  She said that when she wrote "Butterfly," the lyrics are what she wished he would say to her.  Mariah is the "unbridled horse" in the song.   The music video is also based on the Tennessee Williams play "Baby Doll."
